text: Centro (Italian, Portuguese, Spanish and Galician for center [centre], also downtown) may refer to: == Places == *Centro Region, one of the regions of Portugal *Centro Municipality, Tabasco, a municipality in the Mexican state of Tabasco *Centro (Duque de Caxias), a neighborhood of Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil *, a neighborhood of Niterói in Brazil *Centro (borough), Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico *Centro, Porto Alegre, a neighborhood of the city of Porto Alegre, the state capital of Rio Grande do Sul in Brazil *Centro, Rio de Janeiro (the downtown), neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro in Brazil *Centro, Santa Maria, a neighborhood in the District of Sede in the municipality of Santa Maria, in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul *Centro Habana, Cuba *Centro (Mexico City), Mexico *Centro, Mandaue, a barrio in The Philippines *Centro (Madrid), a district of the city of Madrid, Spain *Centro (Málaga), a district of the city of Málaga, Andalusia, Spain *Centro, Montevideo, downtown barrio of Montevideo, Uruguay *Centro (São Paulo) or Central Zone of São Paulo, the historic downtown of São Paulo * , Aracaju, Sergipe, Brazil * Centro Barrio, a subdivision (also called a barrio) of Moca, Puerto Rico == Cultural == * Centro Asturiano de México * Centro Cultural Bella Época, Mexico * Centro Cultural de la Raza, a cultural center in San Diego, California, US * Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía, Spain * Luis A. Ferré Performing Arts Center, Puerto Rico * El Centro Cultural de Mexico, a community space in Santa Ana, Orange County, California, US * El Centro de la Raza, a cultural center in Seattle, Washington, USA == Educational == * Centro de Estudios Puertorriqueños, a research institute on Puerto Rican Studies at the Hunter College of the City University of New York in New York, New York, US == Transport == *Centro, the Central New York Regional Transportation Authority in the United States *Plaxton Centro, a bus body built by Plaxton in the UK *West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive, the body formerly responsible for public transport in the county of West Midlands, England that operated under the Centro brand. == Shopping == *Vicinity Centres, a retail property developer formerly trading as Centro Property Group *CentrO, a shopping mall in Oberhausen, Germany == Media == *Centro Tampa, a Spanish-language newspaper in Tampa, Florida, USA == Products == * Palm Centro == See also == * El Centro (disambiguation) * La Center (disambiguation) * Centro Direzionale (disambiguation) * Central District (disambiguation)
title: Centro
